I have tried un-checking these boxes: "Use recommended performance settings Learn more These settings are tailored to your computer’s hardware and operating system. My version is 95.0 (64 bit)

Total crap, isn't it??? Please explain why. I have just downloaded another browser. If this one is going to work better than Firefox then I will stick to it. I am waiting for your prompt reply as your browser user. Regards, John

title: Secure Connection Failed
content:
Error code: MOZILLA_PKIX_ERROR_OCSP_RESPONSE_FOR_CERT_MISSING Keep getting this error message when trying to access web sites that have always worked before. I had to install an add-in to open these web sites, and others with the same issue, in Edge.

Most of them are Microsoft. Here are a few: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/business/office-365-administration https://www.microsoft.com/Licensing/servicecenter/default.aspx https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=45520

The odd thing about the issue is that sometimes it works and the web sites load, then a few minutes later they don't.

What changed? Is this a profile issue? Is this something you are working on repairing?
creator: morganh

title: Update to 95.0 Lost My Passwords
content:
After Firefox updated to 95.0 all but the last 4 website passwords were gone. I had a recent backup of logins.json and key4.db. I copied the backup file into the profile folder and started Firefox. I went to Setting/Privacy and opened Saved Logins. They were all there....for about 3 seconds....and they started disappearing as I watched until only the last 4 were left. It looked like something was telling Firefox to delete my passwords.

I exited Firefox and put my laptop into Airplane mode...no internet. Copied the logins.json and Key4.db files back into the profile folder. I started Firefox and check and ALL OF MY saved passwords were there. I scrolled the list up and down and even checked a few by clicking on the "EYE". All of the passwords were there for all of my saved sites. I closed and re-opened Firefox once more to make sure and all were still there.

Then, with my Saved Passwords open, I took my laptop out of the Airplane mode and it connected to my wireless network.........and within seconds my passwords started disappearing one by one until only the last 4 were left. I'm stumped.
creator: mel.linville

title: Imposible eliminar certificados digitales
content:
Tengo versión 95.0 (64bits), en windows 7 pro 64bits. Desde hace unas semanas, cuando intento hacer copia de alguno de mis certificados, me da el siguiente error: "Se produjo un fallo por motivos desconocidos al guardar la copia de seguridad del archivo PKCS #12".

He intentado seguir las instrucciones de la FNMT, sin éxito. No llegan a borrarse nunca los certificados.

Debido a ello he seguido otras instrucciones y he borrado algunas de los ficheros .db del perfil, pero tampoco he conseguido que se borren los certificados.

Como último intento, he desinstalado firefox, así como eliminado todas sus carpetas e incluso algunas claves del registro de windows. Posteriormente he hecho una nueva instalación de firefox, pero cuando accedo a certificados, vuelven a aparecer todos los certificados que tenía instalados antes de desinstalar. Como si nunca hubiese eliminado firefox de mi sistema.

En resumen, me es del todo imposible eliminar los certificados y ya no sé que más puedo hacer para poder seguir utilizando este navegador.

Quedo a la espera de saber si hay alguien que pueda echarme una mano para resolver este problema.

Gracias en cualquier caso.
creator: ja.mingorance

title: Facebook non carica le immagini
content: Salve da un po di tempo Facebook non carica piu le immagini. All'apertura va tutto bene, poi man mano che navigo le immagini scompaiono e al loro posto c'è un riquadro a sfondo di colore unico e la dicitura:"Potrebbe essere un'immagine raffigurante il seguente testo.....". Se chiudo il browser e lo riapro le immagini ricompaiono ma dopo poco scompaiono nuovamente. Cosa potrebbe essere successo? Come si potrebbe risolvere? io utilizzo firefox per mac con MacOS High Sierra versione 10.12.6 Grazie.
creator: gianluigicantoni

title: Cannot send emails
content:
Following a change of password with my service provider, I can receive emails but cannot reply or send new emails. Tis is the error message: " Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.btinternet.com. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'."

Efforts to check or edit my Outgoing server (SMTP) password have proved a waste of time. Despite following all available instructions, screenshots, and online comments, I am unable to change or check my SMTP password. I am able to select 'Password' authenication, but not able view or edit the password. I have deleted that particular account and set up a new one with the same email address, but authentication problem remains. I have spent too much time trying to resolve this issue, so now I have no choice but to use annoying 'Windows Mail'. If I cannot resolve this issue, I will have no choice but to bid a sad farewell to the otherwise reliable Thunderbird which I have used for years.

title: Is there any way to set firefox config by active directory group policy?
content:
Hello

I'm Bae, and i'm sorry for my poor English.

I want to make my users be able to use seamless single sign on to Microsoft Azure by setting Firefox config with Active Directory group policy.

First, I created the 'user.js' file and wrote 'user_pref("network.negotiate-auth.trusted-uris","https://autologon.microsoftazuread-sso.com");' and 'user_pref("network.negotiate-auth.delegation-uris","https://autologon.microsoftazuread-sso.com");' in it.

Second, I put this user.js file in the Firefox¥Profiles folder (such as xxx.default-release).

Third, I checked that the setting was changed on about:config.

Last, I also checked that I could use seamless single sign on to "www.office.com".

What I want to do is to distribute this user.js file to my domain users (exactly, to users' firefox profiles folder) by group policy. Please tell me how to do.

Or, if there is any way to set 'network.negotiate-auth.trusted-uris' and 'network.negotiate-auth.delegation-uris' without user.js file, such as Firefox group policy template, please tell me which one I should modify.

Thanks.
creator: sherlocksh

title: Password popup making me insane!!!
content:

This is the ONE thing Chrome handles WAY better than FireFox.

How do I make this stop? And if there's no way other than disabling my master password, then FireFox needs to be updated to handle this differently!

Thanks.

title: How to disable dark mode!?
content:
Hi! This will sound like an odd question, given that everybody seems to search for the opposite - but how could I DISABLE dark-mode in FF95.00?

I have my whole OS in dark-mode the whole time because of looks. I also installed a dark-mode theme on FF. Because of looks. But after the latest updates, FF decided to present a bunch of my favourite websites in dark-mode, too. Even at daytime - where I use my Computer.

Affected websites are, for example such "unknown" websites like "twitter.com", "spiegel.de" or even "facebook.com". It seems like they use some kind of a flag or token, which decides to use darkmode or not. How do I re-enable the light-mode (is this even a word?), not dependent of my windows / FF settings? Is there an add-on?
creator: marcus.wiedner

title: 'Use autoscrolling' and 'Enable DRM' settings keep being unset
content:
Lately, Firefox unchecks the 'use autoscrolling' and 'play DRM-controlled content' options sometimes (but not every time) when it starts. Other settings don't seem to be affected. It does seem to unset both at once, never one or the other at a time.

I have begun using Firefox routinely on two computers, both signed into the same sync profile. My best guess is that maybe one profile is overwriting the other? Both of these options are set on the second system, but maybe there's something going wrong with the sync?

Thanks, Patrick
